I helped @EnvAgency win enforcement funds under Labour. Why didn't @EmmaHowardBoyd resign when enforcement funds were slashed post 2010? We need a government that sacks not appoints pushy mediocrities who prefer being ‚Äúimportant‚Äù over doing what‚Äôs right.

https://t.co/awpdyvRrbb

https://t.co/awpdyvRrbb

tweets.text:
While river levels remain high in parts of the #Midlands we're not expecting much rain over the coming days

Snow is hitting some areas but we're not expecting any impacts so over the next couple of days we're taking down #flood barriers

If needed we can quickly put them back up https://t.co/InkuliemK6

I‚Äôll follow with a few video narratives that will hopefully explain the importance of Earith within the Gt Ouse catchment @EnvAgencyAnglia 

1) Upstream https://t.co/G3vsIzsEAZ

River #flooding is possible in parts of central and east England.

Stay alert and keep away from flooded rivers.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnj1mdd https://t.co/53N5yBFIDE

You can tell that @DefraGovUK isn't serious about protecting our environment when you see that @EnvAgency funding for enforcement activity has halved in the past 10 years
https://t.co/OHEAQXcvZ4 
< no wonder industrial-scale #flytipping and pollution is rife.  Must #StopTheDrop

#floodwarning #bradfordonavon - whilst the flood warning is still in force river levels are heading in the right direction. Some sleety snow in the forecast but hopefully not enough to effect water levels. @Trow_Fire_Stn @BoATownCouncil @DWFRSBoA @EnvAgencySW @WiltshireWinter https://t.co/eruKnAmDkI

Waste criminals pose as genuine waste collectors, take people's money, but dump waste illegally - hurting our environment.  

Help us prevent #WasteCrime.  

If you need to dispose of any rubbish, check your waste carrier is registered: https://t.co/0krpCgwQkt https://t.co/SkB7sPfwvv

@jon_theo @FenEdgeTrail @EnvAgencyAnglia A bit like swimming in a quarry I‚Äôm not sure how you can know what‚Äôs beneath the water. Regardless of how well trained an individual is, it sends the messages to those less expert that it‚Äôs not risky.. placing them in danger and potentially diverting stretched emergency services

The state of the environment in England in now getting worse. A stark comment from the Environment Agency chair to Defra secretary George Eustice in a letter released to me under #FOI. EA chair Emma Howard Boyd blames 50% cuts to her enforcement budget.

tweets.text: @RomneyWeir @thamesmobo @EnvAgencySE It‚Äôs possible I guess. I know the lock staff at boulters and bray used to watch the tailwater height at boulters particularly if it was nearing the trigger towards the end of the day, as it meant they would be needed during the evening or night.

Our teams have been out across the region, checking defences and clearing trash screens following the impacts of #StormBella. Stay vigilant, check your local flood risk at https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/djrnjrBY0t

It may well be snowing in some parts of our region this morning, but we have have quite a few flood alerts and warnings in force. 

Get the latest and our advice on staying safe and dry here: https://t.co/m0cqHfULbD
#floodaware
